Package poolongprojectn7

Class Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • poolongprojectn7.Pattern
  • public class Pattern
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a pattern used by a piano roll to manipulate the musical data in the piano roll. This is a part of the piano roll model.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Pattern()
      Create a new pattern.
      Pattern​(java.lang.String filePath, java.lang.String fileName)
      Load a pattern from a midi file passed in argument.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pattern

        public Pattern()
        Create a new pattern.

      • Pattern

        public Pattern​(java.lang.String filePath,
               java.lang.String fileName)
        throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException,
               java.io.IOException
        Load a pattern from a midi file passed in argument.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file
        fileName - the name of the file
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - if the File does not point to valid MIDI file data recognized by the system
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs Example: Pattern pattern = new Patten("/home/usr/Music/", "test");

    • Method Detail

      • addNote

        public void addNote​(Note note,
                    long startTick)
             throws InvalidNoteException
        Add a note to the pattern at a certain time.
        Parameters:
        note - note to be added
        startTick - starting time of the note in ticks
        Throws:
        InvalidNoteException - if the note attributs are incorrect

                       long startTick)
        Remove a specific note from the pattern.
        Parameters:
        midiNoteNumber - the midi note number of the note to be removed
        startTick - the starting tick of the note

      • save

        public void save​(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save the pattern's sequence in a midi file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file
        fileName - the name of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the given file path is incorrect Example: patten.save("/home/usr/Music/", "test");
